did.abstract: Collection mainly contains letters written to William H. Goodlett from his children, wife, and other relatives, some of whom were also soldiers. Topics include the death of Goodlett's nephew in the war, the Battle of Yorktown, an army units' stay in Columbia, S.C., women who made uniforms for the soldiers, the First Battle of Bull Run, a friend Noel Few, conditions at home, desertions, agriculture prices, and General Grant. There are also two muster rolls, and two vouchers issued by the Confederate commissary in Greenville, S.C.
